website_summaries.verdict: Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor has a cool way to allow your actions to develop your enemies in its Nemesis system. And it looks nice, too, but shallow combat and frustrating design choices mar this Tolkien-inspired PC brawler.
pros: Good voice acting, and dialogue reminiscent of Peter Jackson's Lord of the Rings movies
Nemesis System really builds Orcish Nemeses
cons: Small and empty for an open world

customer_reviews.title: Incredible game and excellent PC performance.
customer_reviews.text: Great game with great graphics and really wonderful combat controls. The action is fluid and easy to get the hang of. The story is kind of ho-hum. For a Tolkien universe game, the story just isn’t front and center or rally very interesting. But if you’re in for the combat you’ll. Be very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are beautiful but I'm disappointed in that it doesn't have a open world, you pretty much go from one area to another either by fast travel or by running, so you will pretty much be fighting at all times with little break in between. Also there is not enough customizing available like in Skyrim as an example. The killing is great and very realistic but can get a little monotonous at times. All in all it's a good game but wait for the price to drop. Also make sure your PC has the horsepower to handle it so you can get those beautiful graphics to show up.
customer_reviews.author: WaRMaCHiNE

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great!
customer_reviews.text: I can be a tactical sniper (focused bow kills) and ninja (shadow stikes, stealth kills) AND! just run around and hack and slash (execution finishers) to my heart's content? I'm only about 2 hours into game play and am thoroughly enjoying the game play. There are gathering missions and hunting missions reminiscent of being a true ranger as well as taming creatures...the whole ghostly effect is pretty awesome as well. Looks like I have something to get me through snow storms and family visits I don't want to participate in
customer_reviews.author: A Fish

customer_reviews.title: fun, but eventually tiresome
customer_reviews.text: Some of the most enjoyable combat mechanics I've come across, slaughtering orcs was never this fun. I found the story compelling and the advancement, rewarding. However, this game gets repetitive after a while, so I recommend not playing it for hours and hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Kookaburra

customer_reviews.title: but this game has definitely kept my attention with its fun and simple
customer_reviews.text: Appropriately violent and entertaining. I am not a fan of video games and I'm not a fan of the Lord of the Rings or the Middle Earth universe, but this game has definitely kept my attention with its fun and simple, without being boring, combat system and immersive environments. The orcs or uruks or whatever they are called are hilarious and well designed and despite the annoying portion of some missions where you have to follow some NPC around for 5 minutes listening to their pointless stories the cutscenes are great and if not can be skipped.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Install
customer_reviews.text: Once again, it's supposed to work with my system, Windows 7. That's what they advertised. But I can't even get it to load to my computer. I click on "Install" and nothing happens. I wasted my money. Whether or not you throw the dice with this one is up to you.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hargis

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is incredible! I have played it continually since it arrived, and luckily installation was quick and easy with no issues. Game play is smooth, and I am astounded by the graphics, music, and overall mechanics of the game. It is by far the best Lord of the Rings based game that I have ever played. I am about 40% completed with the game thus far, and it will definitely be a game that I will replay as often as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Evangeline

customer_reviews.title: Middle Earth Meets Assassin's Creed and Batman Arkham Asylum
customer_reviews.text: This game is like Assassin's Creed mixed with Batman Arkham Asylum. Incredibly fun, doesn't get to repetitive, and the battle system is just fantastic. Though the game is non-cannon in terms of Middle-Earth lore, they do work to tie in some familiar elements from Middle-Earth lore which I appreciate. If you are a big LotR/Tolkien fan or just want to feel like a badass you will like this game.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: Makes husband disappear
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this game... I think... I mean, I'd assume so since I haven't really seen him since he started playing it, and if I go near his computer and he starts mumbling about his precious and gets very possessive... All joking aside, this seems to be a really awesome game. I'd recommend it for anyone familiar with the LOTR/Tolkien world.
customer_reviews.author: PBSJunkie

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed this game
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this game. Great game-play, graphics and story. As a fan of Tolkien, I especially enjoyed the lore. This game takes place between The Hobbit and LOTR and contains plenty of details to keep Tolkien fans enthralled. It is set in Mordor however, so don't expect any cameos from the familiar characters (with one exception.) I spent almost 100 hours with a complete play-through (I'm a little obsessive with all the side-quests). The only negative is that there is very little incentive to play again.
customer_reviews.author: steve whipple

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful game.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great game!!!! the graphics are 10/10, sound is 10/10, gameplay is 10/10. This game plays much like Assassins Creed, but set in Middle-Earth (Mordor). Beautiful game. Must have for any action game or Tolkien fan. The story certainly supports the written material and stays true to the world Tolkien created.
customer_reviews.author: Broodingandbumbling

customer_reviews.title: all around awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome game with a lot of things to do. I would say it's not for the feint of heart though as its gory and uses a lot of key combos to play. Graphics are the best I've seen and are on part with what you'd expect for 2015. I have the pc version though so I can't speak for console formatting.
customer_reviews.author: Kaydee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game. Horrifically bad ending (pretty sure they got bored and gave up).
customer_reviews.text: Ending is s*** (pretty sure they got bored and gave up, or shifted priorities to DLC before they finished the actual game), but the gameplay and lore are fantastic. Graphics are nothing spectacular (2d grass sprites and whatnot) but everything else makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Luke W

customer_reviews.title: Shadow of Mordor
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. There were a lot of times where I felt the was too little or too much of a battle to keep interest. It can be a very repetitive game if you don't take your time. A lot of chasing orcs without a solid plot line or build up. Not the LOTR game I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: One of my most favorite games. If you buy the disc version I ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my most favorite games. If you buy the disc version I suggest that you take the disc out once installation has begun and go through a digital download.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It feels a lot like Assassin's Creed but better
customer_reviews.text: It feels a lot like Assassin's Creed but better. It has nice features from the combat system of the Batman game (Arkum City). Just started playing the game though so don't have more to say right now. I think it's a great game though!
customer_reviews.author: Rain Coille

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what a great game should be. Great story, great action, perfect mix of movies and gameplay, open world, not too hard or too difficult. The graphics look great (although everything should look like this, it's 2015 for Christ's sake). I have had Zero crashes in 12 hours of play and I'm still eager to play more.
customer_reviews.author: Hard2Please

customer_reviews.title: a good game, little stressful
customer_reviews.text: a good game, little stressful, could only play on my window 8 laptop. didn't work on my windows xp or windows 7
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Starts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Game
customer_reviews.text: Great game...combat is awesome...Played about 15 hours and only half through the main story...still have dlc content to play as well. It is a Steam game so you will need account to play. I have a gaming computer and I run at about 85fps on highest settings, great graphics, lots of open world fun.
customer_reviews.author: ultra55371d

customer_reviews.title: The best Assassin's Creed game in years
customer_reviews.text: The title is a bit of a joke, but it truly plays like Assassin's Creed. This game is really fantastic. I'm about halfway through, and loving it. Sometimes when you are in combat, everything clicks and you feel incredible. However, equally is that when you screw up, you know exactly what went wrong. There's nothing random about the game, so you can accurately learn from your mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Ready

customer_reviews.title: It was a fun game. Great cross between Assassin's Creed and Tolkien
customer_reviews.text: It was a fun game. Great cross between Assassin's Creed and Tolkien. The dying and boss mechanic is very cool and wish other games would pick it up. Also riding a Caragors was fun.
customer_reviews.author: David Noonan

customer_reviews.title: This game is awesome! First of all I have never seen or ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! First of all I have never seen or read a Lord of the Rings movie or book and I followed the story pretty pretty well Combat: The combat is the most fun part of the game being that you like beat'em up games that is very smooth and responsive Graphics: The graphics look amazing and I have them on medium to high settings with a Intel i3 and a Geforce 645 GTX Open World: The world is quite nice designed and quite big but the world sometimes looks a bit to much alike
customer_reviews.author: KennethGreeneyes

customer_reviews.title: Great ork killing game
customer_reviews.text: Great game! it reminds me alot of assassins credd but set very nicely in the LOT world. The thing to know about this game is its about killing ork, it does not try to be anything else but that's not a bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: The Blue Bomber

customer_reviews.title: This game is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: It took a wile to DL but it was SOOO worth it I can't stop playing it's so addicting graphics a + game play a ++ wow this game challenges my MSI Titan GT80 SLI great game
customer_reviews.author: C. JONES

customer_reviews.title: Great game, graphics are damn good and game play ...
customer_reviews.text: 5 discs to play the game, it makes sense truly. I bought this because for some reason it was cheaper than its digital counterpart. Great game, graphics are damn good and game play is tough as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Tiddilywinks

customer_reviews.title: Fun game. I bought both expansions as well
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. I bought both expansions as well. It was actually better than I expected. Graphics and gameplay keep me coming back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Be a true LOTR and Hobbit fan. Play this game!
customer_reviews.text: One of he most underrated game I've ever played. This is a highly recommended game in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bodea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun addictive game. Awesome story line which fleshed out Lord of the Rings story line.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Harmon

customer_reviews.title: GOTY 2014!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best games for 2014!!! The story is good. The graphics is good. Gameplay is better. Takes about 20 hours or more to finish the game with some of the side quests. This game deserves the GOTY 2014 award!
customer_reviews.author: yapchagi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good game---similar to Lords of the Rings but better graphics
customer_reviews.author: Martin Clearman

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the Hobbit movies.
customer_reviews.text: A good open world game, but doesn't have the replay value of some of it's peers. Basically, kill orcs. Some orcs will kill you. They are the cool kids. Kill the cool kids.
customer_reviews.author: C Grenard

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Best game of 2014! Hands down! Love it! Sometimes, after a long day, I just go kill the s*** out of orcs for an hour two just to unwind!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N

customer_reviews.title: fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this game, big Lord of the rings fan a little difficult to play when you first start off but once you get the hang of it, it is really enjoyable and fun,, great graphics and story line!!!
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Visarraga

customer_reviews.title: Needs a manual
customer_reviews.text: If they had written a game manual, it would have gotten 5 stars. The tutorials get you through it but some things need more explaining.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you love kicking lots of orc asses, this is your game. Non-stop orc murdering.

customer_reviews.title: Great graphics, but my enjoyment of game was lessened ...
customer_reviews.text: Great graphics, but my enjoyment of game was lessened by the unreasonable difficulty of achieving character advancement.Also lack of a manual is a big negative.The game has many facets to it and the on screen tutorials are too brief and start to blur as the game progresses.

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and fun.
customer_reviews.text: This game is assasins creed combined with the lord of the rings minus the intricate plot. Very simple and fun.

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun game, my only issue was getting killed so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game, my only issue was getting killed so often in the beginning, which was rather too repetitive, of course that passes.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my bestest bud's birthday and he LOVES it! Great buy!

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best Lord of the Rings game there is
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best Lord of the Rings game there is. It's everything assassins creed wishes it was, plus with Lord of the rings. Feels canon to the movies.

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Family approved. Well, my husband and daughter love it anyway. They would both highly recommend it.

customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game, love the Parkour mechanics in this!

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful game.
customer_reviews.text: Very good. The repetitive nature didn't bother me but I found even the high rank enemies to be too easy. The game is beautiful if you've the system powerful enough to crank up the graphics.

customer_reviews.text: I wish that I knew that you needed 64bit Windows 10 and not the 32bit that I have.

customer_reviews.text: Assassins Creed meets Batman Arkham in this great game from The Lord of the Rings universe. Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor is an action role-playing game that takes place between the events of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings. For a first look at the game check out -

customer_reviews.text: Great game and a great price, on sale at $19.99, couldn't pass it up. Was worth the purchase.

customer_reviews.text: Another game for my husband per his request. Amazon always delivers earlier than I expect and with mo problems as a rule!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, had no complaints so I am assuming he loved it. He usually researches all the games before he gives me a list of which to buy.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: lovin this game...u gotta try it... worth every penny and i still suk at it

customer_reviews.title: Take on middle earth batman style
customer_reviews.text: Playing this game reminded me of mechanics used in both assassins creed and batman games. It has a unique take on the lird of the rings and middle earth narratives as well as being an enjoyable game.
customer_reviews.author: nathaniel pugh

customer_reviews.title: Stays fresh thanks to Nemesis
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game. Can start to get repetitive, but the Nemesis system keeps it fresh. Unlike AC, which literally is the same thing over and over after a while, Shadow of Mordor stays fresh. 5*

customer_reviews.text: Great game, a more difficult setting would be nice though because you get pretty powerful at the end the game gets pretty easy.

customer_reviews.title: noooo don't kill that one, I need him

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game, very in depth and a great RPG. One of the better games of 2014 without question. Worth full price, grab it if its on sale

customer_reviews.title: Great gift

customer_reviews.title: ... reviews that folks that aren't fans of LOTR would like this game
customer_reviews.text: I'd read some reviews that folks that aren't fans of LOTR would like this game. I'm not a fan, and thought I'd take a chance because I heard good things about the fighting dynamics. The game seems accurate to the other reviews and I'm sure there's a lot to enjoy here. Personally however, I do not like this game enough to play past the first half hour of it. Just not my thing. I would suggest a console controller like the PC XBOX controller for this game - seems better than the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Mickey Murphy

customer_reviews.title: too short
customer_reviews.text: Great game play, awesome story....would have given 5 stars IF it had taken longer than 18 hrs to finish...I even took my time...

customer_reviews.title: a great game.

customer_reviews.text: Fun cross between Assassin's Creed and the Batman games that WB makes, that is set in Middle-Earth. I got it on sale and it's been well worth the $20 I spent.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice game, not the super innovation people are making it out to be but its good and fun.

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Amazing graphics
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Amazing graphics. I really enjoyed the storyline, but the gameplay felt a bit repetitive. Reminded me a lot of Assassin's Creed.

customer_reviews.text: Great game. Well, unless you're an Uruk. Then it's kinda like playing a video game version of Schindler's List as Amon Goeth.

customer_reviews.title: I love this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing! I spent several hours just exploring the landscape. The fighting scenes are almost always clear, and the game hardly ever freezes.

customer_reviews.title: A ton of fun to play
customer_reviews.text: A ton of fun to play, especially the further you progress. The nemesis keeps things fresh and fun even after 60+ hours of play.

customer_reviews.title: It's my 2nd favorite game ever (right behind Skyrim)
customer_reviews.text: I adore this game. It's my 2nd favorite game ever (right behind Skyrim)

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I haven't been this hooked to a game since Skyrim. Simply amazing.

customer_reviews.title: A fine first-person stabber - if you like that sort of thing
customer_reviews.text: First-person "stabbers" (as opposed to a first-person shooter) aren't really my bag. I prefer strategy-type games. But for what it is, this game delivers. If you want to kills orcs, this is the game for you. You'll do all kinds of horrific damage to the creepy little buggers in a very detailed landscape.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic game play and accurate back story. Well done WB!! Highly recommend!

customer_reviews.title: No good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry. Never got the hang of it. I found it really hard to play.
customer_reviews.author: Ulises Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Well worth your time and money...
customer_reviews.text: This game fits perfectly between The Hobbit and Lord of the Rings stories and really gives you some perspective on the life of the Orcs and Uruks under Sauron. That aside from the fact the game is a lot of fun to play and the nemesis system being outstanding. I highly recommend you pick this game up on whatever gaming system you have.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F Hankins Jr

customer_reviews.title: Bad game interface for PC
customer_reviews.text: The game interface is difficult to use. Make a long game tedious and take away from the well-crafted plot.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Game
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game , had great graphics in it, and was done very well . Keeps me entertained in the game.
customer_reviews.author: Angelastar

customer_reviews.title: Slow, boring, same graphics, repetitive, button masher.  Played 2 days then quit.  Wish I could return.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it. I played it for like 2 days then quit. It is a very slow, boring game, where you run around pushing the same buttons doing the same attacks on the same exact monsters with the same exact graphics. I wasted $30. I wish I could return it. As a LOTR fan/fanatic, I am disappointed in not having fun on this game.
customer_reviews.author: Adrenaline

customer_reviews.title: ... already for ten hours so I know what it's like. Anyway the game is a great mix of ...
customer_reviews.text: I played the game on Steam already for ten hours so I know what it's like. Anyway the game is a great mix of the Batman Arkham games with Assassin's Creed climbing and campaign mission mechanics, which I wish were a little more varied than just following someone. The music is great, the nemesis system is awesome, haven't seen this much innovation in years, also haven't seen Monolith make a game of this Quality since Fear. So welcome back Monolith. Buy this game if you like Lord Of The Rings and if you like Arkham combat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Glaspey

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good game, but arrived later then promised and the case was mangled upon delivery

customer_reviews.title: Good Game

customer_reviews.text: Awesome game!! WIsh it was multi player. Whay can't there be multiple Rangers?!

customer_reviews.title: A Masterpiece
customer_reviews.text: This game's ai combined with its combat system make this amazing. I have only played a few hours so far but I cannot wait to play more. The characters and story line are very well put together. I would seriously recommend getting this game. 10/10

IF you get this game plan to install it at night over about 3 nights of continuous downloading. RIDICULOUS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Game Play stupid premise to play an entire game in stealth mode !
customer_reviews.text: You can not go more than just 10 minutes before you get killed again. You weapons take like a full minute to kill an Orc who then gets 3 times more powerful and by that time ten more have arrived on the scene so you do not have a chance. I will more that likely just delete the whole thing as it takes up like 43 Gigs.

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't save points or location, waste of money, don't buy! Always end up at same tower no matter how many Orcs I kill.

customer_reviews.text: Am unable to play this game. Error message regarding Direct X. Can't find solution. A total bust as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: I have played First Person Shooter games such as Crysis ...
customer_reviews.text: I have played First Person Shooter games such as Crysis and MMORPG games such as World of Warcraft, but this game is way too hard from the beginning. It isn't enjoyable having to work so hard in the first couple of battles. Maybe I can sell my copy......
customer_reviews.author: chefdavis

product_meta.title: Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor by Warner Home Video - Games
product_meta.description: You are Talion, a Ranger of the Black Gate, keeping watch over Mordor which has remained undisturbed for ages. In the blink of an eye, everything is taken from you - your friends, your family, and even your own life. Resurrected by a vengeful spirit, you must now embark on a relentless vendetta against those who have wronged you. Fight through Mordor and uncover the truth of the spirit that compels you, discover the origins of the Rings of Power, build your legend and ultimately confront the evil of Sauron in this new chronicle in Middle-earth. Harness the Spirit of vengeance to inflict brutal combos while mastering powerful new skills and weaponry. Exploit the individual fears, weakness and memories of your enemies as you dismantle Sauron's forces from within. Become the most feared force in Mordor in a new chronicle set before the events of the Lord of the Rings.
feature_bullets: Harness the Spirit of vengeance to inflict brutal combos while mastering powerful new skills and weaponry.
Exploit the individual fears, weakness and memories of your enemies as you dismantle Sauron's forces from within.
Become the most feared force in Mordor in a new chronicle set before the events of the Lord of the Rings.
